Note that this customization is per namespace. That is, even if your schema is split into multiple schema documents, you cannot put them into different packages if they are all in the same namespace.

section.title: Tip: get rid of the org.w3._2001.xmlschema package
section.para: Under some rare circumstances, XJC will generate some Java classes into a package called org.w3._2001.xmlschema. This happens when XJC decides that it needs some Java artifacts for the XML Schema built-in namespace of http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema.

section.para: This is bit tricky, but the idea is that since you can define a schema for one namespace in multiple schema documents, this makes XJC think that this schema is a part of the built-in "XML Schema for XML Schema".
